Material used.Description: Used an EGFP reporter system with let-7 binding sites in the 3'UTR to assess LRRK2 variant effects.

Readout description.Result Description: Pathogenic hLRRK2(G2019S) increased reporter expression compared to wild-type, indicating dysregulated miRNA processing.
Pathogenic dLRRK(I1915T) similarly increased reporter expression, linking LRRK2 kinase activity to miRNA pathway disruption.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments included multiple biological replicates across developmental stages.

Technical replicates.Description: Fluorescence measurements were performed in triplicate for each sample.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 cDNA was used as a baseline control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfections served as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey tests compared variant vs. control groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Reporter activity within 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reporter activity â‰¥50% higher than wild-type baseline.
